comments.body: Will add apple doc link as soon as posted.

*Titanium Reference:* http://www.appcelerator.com/blog/2015/04/how-to-use-density-specific-images/
We will need to consider the current method titanium developers are used to, and based on that, how best to integrate app thinning.
Will the implementation of this force apps to enable bitcode?

As far as I can tell, although bitcode is part of app thinning, it has nothing to do with xcassets. Currently bit code is enabled YES in build settings by default in every Xcode project in Xcode 7 Beta 3.

Thanks Chee for the info. Is it possible to request support to disable bitcode in the build settings? 

I ask because we have many 3rd party frameworks and if they all have to support bitcode then we will not be in good shape to build with iOS 9. I am concerned that Xcode 7 defaults it to Yes and that there needs to be an ability to set it to No for those who are not able to fully use it yet due to special circumstances. Would that be possible? 

Or do I need to file a new ticket for that request? 

Thanks,  
Travis
We are actually in the midst of considering that, thank you for your input. It will be great if you could file a new ticket for this.

Latest updated [docs|https://developer.apple.com/library/prerelease/ios/documentation/Xcode/Reference/xcode_ref-Asset_Catalog_Format/FolderStructure.html#//apple_ref/doc/uid/TP40015170-CH18-DontLinkElementID_2] from Apple.

Note: This clearly describes that even if you group the images, all assets filenames in the asset catalog MUST be unique.

All subtasks are complete. Resolving this issue.

h4. Steps to Test
1. Using [~fokkezb] app in http://www.appcelerator.com/blog/2015/04/how-to-use-density-specific-images/
2. After build, verify all images are in the asset catalog in the Xcode project in <project folder>/build/iphone

Also test if packaged app (for specific device) is app thinned.

Verified implemented, using:

MacOS 10.11.2 (15C27e)
Studio 4.4.0.201510290507
Ti SDK 5.1.0.v20151028190028
Appc NPM 4.2.1
Appc CLI 5.1.0-38
Ti CLI 5.0.5
Alloy 1.7.16
Arrow 1.3.13
Xcode 7.2 (7C46l)
Node v0.12.7
Java 1.7.0_80
production

Images are put into asset catalog in the Xcode project. App thinning successfully reduces app size and images available in exported archive
